[Table of contents](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/23111842.html)
# VideoManager Admin Guide
  * Last updated:Nov 6, 2025
  * DeutschFrançaisPortuguês (Brasil)
    * [](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/search?labelkey=product_category_video_security_body_cameras__in-car_video_body_cameras)
    * [](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/search?labelkey=product_category_video_security_body_cameras__in-car_video_in-car_video_systems)
    * [](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/search?labelkey=product_az_videomanager_ex)
    * [](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/search?labelkey=modality_user_guide)


**Version: MN010887A01-AK, System Release: 25.4, Release Date: November 2025**
## What's New
  * [Home](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/7b96a201.html "When you log on, the first tab you see is your Home tab. This section provides a summary of the information and media available to you on VideoManager.")
  * [Searching Devices](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/b3a60c78.html#b05f6905 "Users with appropriate permissions can utilise search functions on VideoManager to locate devices in the Devices tab, which can be necessary if you need to discover the status of various devices \(for example, whether they are recording, and who is using them\), or if you want to assign a device so that media can be recorded.")
  * [Assigning Devices with Permanent Allocation](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/b3a60c78.html#5c2d0d7d "Similar to Permanent issue, Permanent allocation associates a device with a user indefinitely. Once the user redocks the device, it remains assigned to them. However, unlike Permanent issue, Permanent allocation forces users to tap their RFID cards before they can undock and operate their devices, and configuration is required in order to use this feature.")
  * [Admin](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html "The Admin tab provides access to system administration functions.") reorganisation
  * [Performing Network Profile Actions](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#d3c17147 "VideoManager uses network profiles to control the connectivity options available for a device. A network profile is a collection of WiFi networks, which a device can connect to when attempting to live stream media.")
  * [Configuring RFID Settings](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#f7c77368 "The RFID settings allow you to configure how a tag should be processed on a per-tag type basis. For each tag type, it is possible to configure a mode and a post-processing script.")
  * [Configuring Deletion Policies](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#0b84a9c3 "Deletion policies are used to control the way in which media, incidents, exports, and audit logs are automatically deleted from the system to free storage space.")
  * [System](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#71f28176 "In the System pane, you can edit aspects of VideoManager relating to storage and server configuration.")
  * [Device Permissions](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/94516ad6.html#a4ff3992 "The Device permissions pane offers control over assigning and operating different devices.")
  * [V500 Device Profile](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/222aa2e3.html#6f428942)
  * [V200 Device Profile](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/222aa2e3.html#01a9c081)
  * [Types of Reports](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/112f343c.html "VideoManager offers many types of reports providing you with multiple ways to retrieve high-level information about specific actions and statistics pertaining to your system. You can run a series of preconfigured reports, which come with VideoManager by default and can provide you with information about key system parameters. The following appendix covers every type of report that can be created, and the corresponding columns and values they contain.")
  * [Glossary](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/87b56806.html)
  * [Changing Viewing Options](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4d3cd2f0.html#e6ae24af)
  * [Media Permissions](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/94516ad6.html#83cf2b38 "The Media permissions pane offers control over the various operations that can be performed on media files.")
  * [Advanced Permissions](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/94516ad6.html#91c7427f "The Advanced permissions pane offers control over access control keys, viewing sites, and changing manager settings.")
  * [M500/M500E USB Drive Transfer Agent](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/9f30f5bb.html#24d8bf91 "The USB Drive Transfer Agent is a software application that connects to VideoManager to automatically transfer recorded events and state captures from a USB-connected M500 in-car system and from an M500E SD card to VideoManager.")
  * [Enabling and Configuring Analytics](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#4885af62 "Enabling analytics for the system or users allows to send the data for analysis to further improve VideoManager.")
  * [Security](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#81aebfb9) along with its subsections
  * [Import from a USB-Connected M500 and M500E In-Car Systems](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/9f30f5bb.html#b0171633 "The USB Drive Transfer Agent imports state captures into VideoManager if present on the USB drive or an SD card but imports them separately from events, importing events first and then state captures.")
  * [Migrating Access Control Key Authenticated Devices to New Addresses](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#59ed3e6b "As part of the implementation of the Device Server Certificate Verification section, all access control key authenticated devices must have their own listen address. To enable certificate verification without having to manually reconfigure all docks, you can access the migration wizard to add new listen and public addresses for access control key authenticated devices, which will automatically send the new configuration to all connected docks.")
  * [Audit Log Events](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/e2f418d5.html)
  * [User Permissions](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/94516ad6.html#e34e7887 "The User permissions pane offers control over what power a user has to change the information of other users and groups on the system.")
  * [Creating, Editing, and Deleting Users](https://docs.motorolasolutions.com/bundle/89303/page/4a801fc3.html#3ab0295f "A user is assigned to every person using VideoManager. Different users have varying levels of control over the system, depending on how they have been configured.")

description: The VideoManager Admin Guide provides comprehensive instructions for setting up, configuring, and troubleshooting the VideoManager system, focusing on its key features and functionalities. Key topics include user management, video storage options, system integration, and performance optimization, making it essential for technical support staff and users involved in video surveillance and management. Use cases highlighted in the guide encompass system deployment, user access control, and incident response strategies.
